What is the project vision of Verus Coin?

The project vision of Verus Coin is to create a marketplace of provisioned public blockchains as a service (PBaaS) that can be used to run public applications, such as polls and voting. The ultimate goal is to have decentralized applications that can provision and use these chains automatically, paying Verus miners, stakers, and service providers for their services.

just to get some in case it catches on. If enough people think the same way, that becomes a self fulfilling prophecy. Once it gets bootstrapped, there are so many applications if you could effortlessly pay a few cents to a website as easily as dropping coins in a vending machine.

When I stumbled upon this email around the new year, it struck me how accurate these predictions have manifested. I also had to stop and look a little deeper and ask what more might Satoshi have envisioned than simply “digital cash.” Although bitcoin was originally used as digital money, I believe Satoshi saw it as much, much more…and believe this email eludes to it.
What’s Next for Blockchain?
It occurred to me that the simple application of money in the bitcoin, was only the beginning of progress and what is possible to expand from this original use case. Particularly the underlying theme of blockchain services is an innovative progression of the invention of bitcoin.
The Verus Coin’s project vision is a marketplace of provisioned public blockchains as a service (PBaaS) that are used to run public applications, including polls and voting. The goal is ultimately decentralized applications that provision and use these chains automatically, paying Verus miners, stakers, and service providers for provisioning and services.
Verus is a 100% fairly launched, no-ICO, no-pre-mine community project and introduces a new consensus algorithm called Proof of Power, a 50% proof of work / 50% proof of stake algorithm, which solves theoretical weaknesses in other PoS systems and is provably immune to 51% hash attacks, making Verus one of, if not the most double-spend resistant public blockchain(s) running.
With its groundbreaking consensus protocol, Verus also uses a unique hash algorithm, VerusHash 2.0, a quantum secure hash algorithm that is near-equally mineable on

What makes Verus a unique blockchain project?

Verus is a unique blockchain project because it is a 100% fairly launched, no-ICO, no-pre-mine community project. It also introduces a new consensus algorithm called Proof of Power, which is a 50% proof of work / 50% proof of stake algorithm that solves theoretical weaknesses in other PoS systems and is provably immune to 51% hash attacks. Additionally, Verus uses a quantum secure hash algorithm called VerusHash 2.0, which is near-equally mineable on various hardware.

What are the benefits of Verus's consensus protocol, Proof of Power?

The benefits of Verus's consensus protocol, Proof of Power, include its ability to solve theoretical weaknesses in other PoS systems and its provable immunity to 51% hash attacks. This makes Verus one of, if not the most, double-spend resistant public blockchain(s) running.
